body_content.explanation: to be able to stay at the surface of water rather than going under the water:
examples: You can keep afloat for longer if you lie on your back.
She was treading water to keep afloat.

body_content.explanation: to have enough money to pay what is owed and buy what is needed:
examples: The business had to sell off some of its assets to keep afloat.
They took out a $2,000 loan to keep afloat until they were paid.

body_content.explanation: to remain successful, or to keep doing well :
examples: During isolation, the people I met online and talked with over the internet kept me afloat emotionally.
His excellent performance, match after match, is the only thing that kept the club afloat this season.
